recipes.title: Fluffy Chole Bhature
recipes.author: Anita
recipes.description: A plate where comfort meets indulgence, and every bite is a celebration of spice, soul, and satisfaction.

For Chole (spiced chickpeas): 1 cup dried chickpeas (or 2 cups canned chickpeas)
1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
1 teaspoon chole masala (optional, for enhanced flavor)
1/2 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder) or juice of 1/2 lemon

instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Pressure cook with water and a pinch of salt until soft.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Stir in tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Saute onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies.
Add cooked chickpeas with water. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add chole masala, amchur powder, and salt. Garnish with coriander leaves.
In a bowl, mix flour, semolina, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt.
Add yogurt and mix. Gradually add water to knead a soft dough.
Cover with a damp cloth and rest for 1-2 hours.
Divide dough into balls. Roll each into a round or oval shape.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Fry bhature until golden and puffed.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with chole.

recipes.title: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.author: Rajesh
recipes.description: A rich, creamy, and aromatic paneer dish with a buttery tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and lightly fry paneer cubes with turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Set aside.
In the same pan, add butter and oil. Sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until aromatic.
Pour in tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.
Add kasuri methi, garam masala, sugar, and salt. Mix well.
Stir in heavy cream and mix until smooth and creamy.
Add the fried paneer cubes to the gravy and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.
